posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.45 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group .

Release notes:

  • Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

This beta release continues a new feature we’re ready to test: linked device history syncing! In short, we’re using an end-to-end encrypted, device-independent backup format to optionally sync message history to newly-linked devices. This is a feature we’re super excited to release and we know many of you have been waiting for. We released a test run of this feature for Android → Desktop linking before the holidays, and we’re now ready to open it up for iOS as well. (Please check out that forum post for more technical details and an FAQ!)

Specifically, with this beta you’ll be able to sync message history:

  1. From a primary iPhone to a special Desktop build you can download from the earlier forum post .
  2. From a primary iPhone or Android to an iPad.

NOTE: Testing this involves a new linking of the device. The special Desktop build can be installed side-by-side with your existing Desktops, but unfortunately due to technical limitations we can’t do the same on iPad; so, testing this requires deleting existing Signal data from your iPad (either via Settings → Account → Delete All Data or by reinstalling) and re-linking. Re-linking will restore your message history and last 30 days of media, but as this is a new feature, bugs may exist; please use appropriate caution before deciding to test.

If you decide to test, please post logs (and any issues you encounter either during or after the sync) here or on the original forum post ! They’re helpful both if there was an error and if it succeeded (so we can get a sense of things like performance).

Thank you, as always, for being beta testers. We couldn’t build these features without your help.

link_counts.title: Help us test desktop history syncing!
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.44 release

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: As an additional note, as of today’s beta releases for iOS, Android, and Desktop, you should now be able to link from an iPhone or Android to either and iPad or Desktop!

New Version: 7.45.0.590-beta

43 new commits since 7.44.0.583-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.45 [1]

  • Fix a bunch of code related to updating groups [2]

  • Allow same-revision group updates to be applied [3]

  • Remove unused result from “leave group” job [4]

  • Wrap Storage Service operations in bg tasks [5]

  • Rebuild ProvisioningQRCodeViewController in SwiftUI [6]

  • Use a monotonic clock when benching Backups [7]

  • Add debug-only support for GSEs [8]

  • Remove some (mostly) unused group update results [9]

  • Add & use database table for GSEs [10]

  • Clean up code to fetch GSEs when sending messages [11]

  • Notify when unexpectedly fanning out messages [12]

  • Cancel SerialTaskQueue tasks in reverse order [13]

  • Prioritize own profile avatar fetch after restoring backup [14]

  • On unrecognized failures, check the remote endpoint for upload progress [15]

  • Add AttachmentBackupPointer and AttachmentPointer [16]

  • Fix taskQueueLoader test flake [17]

  • Clean up Upload error handling [18]

  • Try downloading from media tier when tapping a message with undownloaded attachments [19]

  • Break up link'n'sync long polls into shorter repeated requests [20]

  • Rebuild ProvisioningTransferQRCodeViewController in SwiftUI [21]

  • Show cancel button during link'n'sync waiting steps after a timeout [22]

  • Tweak some backups errors/warnings [23]

  • Add some throughput logging to attachment upload. [24]

  • Only suspend message processing on primary after we await secondary's linking [25]

  • Update to latest Backup.proto [26]

  • Increase maximumFileSize [27]

  • Satisfy all sticker message attachment downloads when we download the sticker pack [28]

  • Drop 1:1 story replies in Note To Self [29]

  • Add test case support for Group.blocked [30]

  • Loosen fallback case on messageFromOtherRecipientInContactThread and make it a warning [31]

  • Only allow revisions on standard and direct-story-reply messages [32]

  • Make link'n'sync request timeouts 5 mins [33]

  • Don't mark restored payments as new on first ipad reconcile [34]

  • Rotate LinkNSync capability [35]

  • Improve sync message naming & type enforcement [36]

  • Don’t save our own GSE to the database [37]

  • Ignore or use fallback for unrecognized backup enums/oneOfs for forwards compatibility [38]

  • Ignore quoted reply bodies with empty text when exporting backup [39]

  • Remove unused DebugUIProfile page [40]

  • Add snapshots to profile key messages [41]

  • Update release notes [42]

  • Update translations [43]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.44.0.583-beta…7.45.0.590-beta

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked: iPhone and iPad on latest Beta-Version: Synchronisation worked perfectly, it was fast and with no problem.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Sorry to hear that. Would you mind submitting some IPS files (https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007318591-Debug-Logs-and-Crash-Reports#ios_debug), starting with the most recent ones? The crash unfortunately isn’t visible in your logs.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Thanks for the report! We’ll get this fixed ASAP.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: I’ve DMd you the file :)

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Thanks all for the reports. Just released a new build, should be available momentarily, and should fix the issues reported here.

Please keep the reports coming – they are incredibly valuable!

New Version: 7.45.0.592-beta

2 new commits since 7.45.0.590-beta:

  • Defensively limit skipped row ids for SQL query to 50 [1]

  • Make invalid names in a profile change update message a non-fatal error [2]

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
It seems it’s no longer crashing but I’m not able to download any media on my linked iPad :(

I’m going to give relinking again a try, or should I wait?

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.45.0/5005bcacfaf043e1e698b7ac2024a15651df028041a6216cf12fbca62fe0c770.zip

Edit: Turns out I just had a lot of stickers to download and it took a very very very long time lol

Also, my stickers seem to eternally have the loading icon. It only shows up for stickers I’ve sent and not stickers I’ve received from others.

I also find that some media when navigating backwards 45 days don’t autodownload. Same with some random stickers, which seem to be spread around randomly, from either side.

Couldn’t download a few sticker nor reply to them.

On Desktop when you try to download media older than the TTL it tells you: “This media is no longer available”. Perhaps it would be appropriate to add that here to avoid confusion? Or clear messaging?

Newer debug log after going all the way back through a chat to TTL.

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.45.0/5f928832f3014bf8aa76d7119c661407e0678a3140ea6fc76d216c5519477ac2.zip

sashaweiss-signal:

We’ll get this fixed ASAP.

With the latest update it is, thanks.

Minor issue:
3 random conversions showed up on to of the list with an update of the disappearing messages timer.

IMG_0037739×588 45.6 KB

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.45.0/8da52b6b0e1134cfc6ad210ad00b1547704a9b9c633adcb7affa50e6ca285628.zip

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.46 release

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Thanks for the report! Would you mind submitting debug logs from your Android primary device as well?

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Thanks for following up. Glad it’s no longer crashing!

Are you able to download non-sticker media that’s not older than 45d? The iPad will be trying to restore all the available attachments in the background.

We have UI being built for the no-longer-downloadable media, coming soon :)
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.1/da47cf644243853b245a612d2e2b64c38850b2fca7bc481c26f2b22b8ce8101c

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Thank you! We’re investigating. Glad it went well otherwise :)

posts.cooked: After one of the recent builds, all my muted groups (potentially all chats) have been unmuted. Unfortunately, I don’t know which build exactly and it could also be due to the desktop app.
